author: yodaccm
title: A Surprisingly Good Set!
review:
When I first saw this set here on Brickset, I knew I had to get it.  I'm not sure what about it caught my eye first:  the new Talz chieftain minifig, the cool new winter garb for Anakin, or the sweet, sleek new speeder from the Clone Wars series.

First, I have to groan about the ridiculous $35 price tag for a set that only has 177 pieces.  That is the only thing that kept me from giving this set the coveted "5" rating.  

The speeder itself is a nice design.  The big engines on the back really give it some heft, it has three runners on the bottom and a nice little storage compartment concealed behind the cockpit.  As for the cockpit, it is not entirely enclosed.  However, Lego has finally fixed the problem with cockpit domes constantly breaking off when trying to open them by making the connection point connect to 4 studs instead of the usual 2.  Hooray!

As for the minifigs, they are top notch.  Anakin new torso is great with a nice Republic emblem emblazoned on it as does the new hood he is sporting.  His head is two sided, one being the regular Clone Wars Anakin face, and the other being a wind whipped, frost bitten, goggled version which adds some variety.

The Talz cheiftain, named Thi-Sen, is a nice addition to the growing family of Star Wars alien minifigs.  It is always a pleasure to see new, less exposed characters from the movies or cartoons getting minifigs.  However, these new minifigs may explain the outrageous price tag.

All in all the Freeco speeder is a nice set, especially for the wintery holidays!  It fits in nicely with the Hoth sets that have been trickling in these past few years.  I picked mine up at TRU this past week, so start looking for them on the shelves and pick one up!

author: Camo_Hat
title: Awesome new characters....... check!
review:
I got this set for christmas and i built it immediatly.

Build:
nice build. the instructions could have been a bit more detailed about where you put things, but other than that agreat build. it was not to difficult but not to easy.

Speeder:
a nice additiion to the grouping of speeders LEGO has come out with. there is a storage area to hold an electrobinocular and anakins lightsaber handle but once again there is no place for the sword part so it just sits off to the side until anakin needs it.

Characters:
Anakin is awesome. he comes in a parka and has a two sided head. i know your going to say this is a bad point but the other side of his face has a ski mask and goggles which is just awesome if you ask me. thi sen is the best part of the set. not only is he exclusive to this set but he is also a LEGO star wars alien which is great for me because i collect Lego star wars aliens. anyone got a geonosian? thi sen is the icing on the cupcake but they could have included the senator from pantora or something.

Overall:
a great set and definently worth getting. 4 out of 5.

author: THX_1138
title: Very Nice!
review:
This is an awesome set. I got incredibly lucky last night at an almost Lego-free Target after visiting about 3 Wal-Marts without any luck, finding this behind one of the light up covered Power Miners displays, probably hidden by someone wanting to come back for it later and hoping no one else would find it. I had loved the Freeco speeder design ever since I first saw it in the Clone Wars episode, and wanted to make one but couldn't think of any way to make it in minifig scale. Shortly after that, pictures of this set were appearing. I though it looked good, but a bit big.

Pros:
-Great looking.
-Thi-Sen.
-Anakin with double sided head.
-Although it has stickers, they are easy to place and look great.
-Fun, mostly non-repetative build.
-The price isn't too bad if you don't get it at Toys'R'Us, where it is $35 (everywhere else, it is $25).
-Though rather ugly, the new cockpits stay on a little better (I never had a problem with them coming off, though).
-Some good detail, like the area around the 'ice picks' (and no, those aren't actually ice picks, those are supposed to look like a small detail on the real speeder).
-It's always nice when a model has a cockpit that actually opens and doesn't just come off.

Cons:
-Horrible price if bought at TRU.
-It would look terrible if you don't apply the stickers, and would barely have any color at all aside from the red on the wings.
-The new cockpit piece is very ugly.

Overall, this is a very good set, but I think I would feel a little different about it had I gotten it at TRU. I would recommend getting it, but only at Target, Wal-Mart, Lego stores or anywhere else with a reasonable price.

author: baylego
title: Greatest Speeder Bike Ever!
review:
Said in my title, this is probably the best speeder bike TLG has ever made. 

 One of the big points in this set is the minifigs. Thi-Sen is very cool, and his silver spear is very rare. Anikin is very detailed and looks a lot like the actual episode. He has an updated version of his normal face on his face on the other side of his head.
 
 The speeder is a bit blocky in the front, but is pretty aerodynamic. Underneath the white cockpit is a storage area for a few extra pieces. The two ice picks on the sides of the speeder were a very nice detail, too. This set has 4 1X2 white cheese slopes, two 1X3 white tiles and 1 1X4 white tile.

 The only thing to complain about is the price. $34.99 at TRU should be avoided at all costs. The MSRP of $24.99 is still a little high, but it might be worth it depending on what you want. Overall, I would say this set is definitely one to pick up if you don't have it already.

author: frostlass
title: A New Minifig!
review:
minifigs: The minifigs are cool. There's anakin skywalker dressed up in Hoth gear with a two sided face (one side is his regular side and the other he's all dressed up in his snow gear.) and a completley new minifig, 
Thi-sen! Thi-sen is a grey monster that has four eyes. He also has a spear! I think his monster type is called a tal ( TAUL).That's how to pronounce the  word. 

            Though, the freeco speeder is cool itself. Behind the cockpit you can take off the white dome piece and under it there's a little place where Anakin stores his binoculars. His lightsaber might not fit, but, you can try because I lost mine at home.It also features an opening cockpit That doesn't break as easily off because the old two dots they use to use for cockpit has become a nice sturdy four dot cockpit! I'm pretty glad that they improved their cockpit structure a lot! The engines on the sides and the snow skis on the bottom make it look cool too!

So, if you see this set at your local target, why don't you grab one for yourself? I totally recommend this set to any star wars set and I give a *****/***** (5/5) !

author: trust351

author: P13c30fch33s3
title: Only one MASSIVE PROBLEM
review:
This problem is the problem that prevents me from giving this set 5*, as i believe the set without that flaw would be 10000000000000000000*. This problem is the price. $50 AUD for 177 pieces? That's worse than the 7681 Spider Droid. And that's an achievement. (A bad one, mind you). From now on, I will split the speeder up (quite literally) and review each section.

The Minifigs:
One of the main attractions of this set. Anakin is not new, but Anakin in Snow Gear is new. Anakin has a double sided face: one normal and one one full snow gear. It is virtually impossible to turn it without removing the hood, but since you wouldn't remove your goggles in a blizzard, i find it alright.
Thi Sen is a completely unique figure on the other hand, with a very large head sculpt that prevents him from bending his legs back very far. However, it is very accurate to the actual alien, and i think it looks brilliant. The spear is a great addition, beat i think they should've included a Talz club as well (for parrying the lightsabre). Overall, 10/10 for the minifigs.

The excellent new cockpit pieces + the rear storage:
The new cockpit sculpt is an improvement on the old. Although some people say they didn't have issues, I found that the original sculpt tended to be loose and sometimes fall off in violent flying manuevers. The new sculpt is square at the front and holds on much better. The storage space is more than sufficient for Anakin's lightsabre and his binoculars. The box in the back holds the binoculars and the handle, while the blade must simply be dropped in and one must 'hope' that it stays there. Overall, 7.5/10 The lack of space for the blade really lets the set down.

The Engines + a modified swivel feature:
The large outrigger engines are held onto the base plate by: technic pins and 2 2*1 1/3 plates each. holding the two 2*1 plates together on each side is a 2*1 cheese wedge, or to be technical, a 30 degree 2*1 2/3 height slope piece. This can be modified to turn the Freeco speeder into VTOL craft (vertical take-off + landing) with swivelling engines. The 2 2*1 must be turned 90 degrees in either direction, and the 2*1 cheese wedge must be kept in the same position. This allows the technic pin to swivel freely, and through it, the large engines. The engines are mainly made up of a very common but useful engine piece found in the X wing, among other sets and is the perfect size for the engines. The rear discs are held in place by hammers, like the guns on the 8019 Shuttle. Overall: 9/10 - Lego should find a way not pin stuff together with the hammer.

The rear plates:
Nothing special, but it is sturdy and and holds the other parts together well. 10/10

The long Nose Cone + Ice Picks + Cockpit area:
This section is the longest part of the set. The Nose itself is nothing special Although it does make use of 2*4 2/3 curved pieces. At the rear of the nose cone, there are two ice picks. Their purpose in that position eludes me, but what I can tell you is that it could probably tear apart anything in the way. The cockpit is a problem. Although the cockpit piece is excellent, the minifigure inside is exposed at the bottom, just above the 1*3 tiles. This is the only major problem I can see with it. Overall, 9/10, the cockpit being the only problem.

Pros:
 - accurate
 - fits minifigs easily
 - fits most accessories
 - skis do good hover effect
Cons:
 - cockpit gaps
 - no guns
 - too expensive
 - too small for price
 - lightsabre blade doesn't store properly

Overall: 9/10
Get this if you:
a) don't mind high prices
b) collect star wars
c) want new cockpit pieces (although 5981 Raid VPR is cheaper and has the cockpit)
d) can get the set for a fair price (like me)
e) desperately want the set (like i used to)
note: a combination of these is better than just one.
thx for reading

author: lesar3
title: Lovely set
review:
Freeco Speeder
177 parts
24.99 $ or 210 kn in Croatia

I got this set for my birthday, box ain't small, but it ain't big... something in the middle
There a lot of useful white parts. Minifigs are great in this set, I'm glad there's no normal and boring Anakin, 'cause in this set he comes in totally new gear. His legs are normally grey, torso printed, and this thing on head (I can't remember it's name) has printed Republic amblem. Anakin has two-sided head, on one side is his normal face, and on other his face covered with something and glasses on and he comes with chrome lightsaber. Second minifig is Thi-Sen, he is new minifig, and this is first and only for now set in which he appear. He's design is amazing, it's very detailed and he come with grey spear.
Speeder itself is pretty big and stable. Only bad part is alot of stickers, nothing printed

author: TangDynasty
title: Nice set except...
review:
I have been reading the reviews here for some time and I thought I will give it a shot in writing my first review. So here goes...

My son has set his eyes on this set the moment it came out. But the price, at S$55(!) is way too much for me to pay. We managed to get it at S$45 after a discount. 

It was fairly easy to build the set for my 7 year old son. The speeder felt solid, sturdy and compact. The stickers give a good finishing touch to the speeder. The size is good and it was fun to play with. One thing to note... we have problem with getting Anakin to hold on to the handles inside the cockpit. It was cram and we ended up not having him holding the handles at all. 

Here are my pros and cons:

Pros:

- The minifigs are cool
- Nice solid feel of the speeder
- Overall nice design of the speeder

Cons:

- It's too expensive for a small set
- The cockpit looked unfinished with a huge gap

Overall, 7/10. 

It is still a nice set and the minfigs are really.

I hope my review will be able to give you some insight to the set and I hope to post more reviews in the future.

Thanks for reading!

author: Mageamooney
title: A Brilliant Little Clone Wars Speeder
review:
The Freeco Speeder is a great small set, which includes some great exclusive minifigs, and some fairly rare parts.

 

Pros:

  • Nice, exclusive minifigs,
  • Very episode-accurate,
  • Rare pieces

Cons:

  • None!

Summery:

The Freeco Speeder is a brilliant set, with some great parts and figures, and I would recommend it to any fan of The Clone Wars!

author: desire4one
title: Freeco Speeder, or BattleStar Viper in hiding?
review:
This set had a homey feel to it.  I purchased it New Years eve while staying at a friends house, and everybody couldn't help but pick it up and play with it at the party.  It has playability right out of the box, although I've seen better.  Most of the parts are rare and give the set a bump in quality.  And how cool is it to have a Talz mini figure?  That guy can be used for just about any set.  Scary cave monster anyone?  The thing that struck me most about this set was that it reminded me very much of a Viper from Battle Star Galactica.  With a few changes, you've got one, the front end and cockpit already figured out for you.  Mine turned into a customer Rebel Z-95 Headhunter within days of having it at home.

Pros:

  • Good parts and pieces included.  I think the cheapest set for the new clear canopy featured in so many of the new Star Wars sets. 
  • Mini figs are good.  Talz Chieftan and Anakin with Parka.  As a bonus, Anakin's face is wrapped in a scarf.  He could doulbe as any number of shady characters.
  • Price was reasonable for what you got.  This retails for $25 and I wasn't dissapointed.

Cons:

  • They cut a few corners on this set, but only a few.  Hammers to hold the rear color discs in place?  It just looks a little cheesy.

Overall this is a good set.  If you're a builder I recommend it for the parts alone.  Collectors - Talz mini fig.  Nuff said.

review:
These is a realy great set for everyone who like Star Wars the Clone Wars.From building to playng it is a real blast.OK let's skip to the good part.

author: ScarVader
title: Ride Through The Snow With The Freeco Speeder!
review:
Best Republic Speeder Ever!

This set is probably the best speeder ever designed by LEGO. Here are some details about the set.

The Minifigures

The are two minifigures in this set and they are Anakin Skywalker and Thi-Sen/Talz Chieftain which both of them are exclusive and unique to this set. Anakin Skywalker has a double sided face. One side shows his original face and the other is him with goggles and a piece of cloth over his mouth. Anakin Skywalker is wearing snow gear which is different from Han Solo's snow gear as Anakin Skywalker's has a Jedi Emblem on his hood and torso. He is also equipped with a Blue Lightsaber with the new chrome design hilt which was first introduced in 8017 Darth Vader's TIE Fighter in 2009.

Thi-Sen/Talz Chieftain is made up similar to Chewbacca. His head part is all one piece going over the torso. The detail on Thi-Sen/Talz Chieftain is amazing as it has all been done out of plastic and no rubber. He is equipped with a Light Pearl Spear (This colour was used in some of the 2005 LEGO Star Wars Sets). 

The Speeder

The speeder is quite big and is mostly white with some red Republic colouring. The speeder has two features:

  • Opening cockpit to put Anakin Skywalker at the controls.
  • Put Anakin Skywalkers lightsaber and electro-binoculars in the cargo hold.

The set contains eight stickers/decals and some new pieces such as:

  • 2v4 white smooth plate.
  • 2v1 white slope two studs high.
  • 1v3 white smooth plate.
  • The cockpit screen and back white screen has been slighty altered with a square bit in front to hold down the piece more.

Overall Review With Pros & Cons

Pros:

  • Two Exclusive Minifigures!
  • Well Designed Set!
  • New Pieces!
  • Plenty Of Republic Colouring!

Cons:

  • Too many stickers/decals.
  • The cockpit has a gap on each side where no pieces have been added.
  • The cockpit is not flush with the backscreen of the cargo hold.

I would definately recommend this to a friend and will make a perfect gift to any child or adult or somebody who wants to expand their Republic Army!

author: Mgaeta92
title: The Cool Freeco Speeder
review:
I picked up this set in early july thinking *Wow a cool looking set that is being discounted* (at the time it was $20 at Walmart). I decided to pick it up. The value for the money I spent on it I think was excellent.

Pros

  • Thi-Sen is amazing with his spear
  • Double Sided Anakin head also amazing
  • Extra Ice-pick
  • Macro Binoculars

Cons

  • No hair for Anakin if you want him not to wear the parka hood
  • Obi Wan would have been a better figure in the set
  • TOO MANY STICKERS

Overall Summery

I feel that if you like The Clone Wars series you should get this set because it is a good addition to a Clone Wars collection. I hope you like the review and keep on bricking

author: legoclone
title: Aside from the cockpit area - a great set.
review: This is a great little kit in most regards.   The new mini-figs are cool and the basic vehicle is faithful to the vehicle as depicted in The Clone Wars.   My one big disappointment is the cockpit area.  It is as if the day was ending and the Lego design team wanted to go home early.  The Anakin figure has to be crammed in at a funny angle and can’t hold the handlebars and forget fitting a clone in there with the space needed for their helmet ridge.  I was also disappointed in the massive cockpit gap.

author: flyguy
title: A surprisingly great little set, and a great vehicle.
review:
The price of this in Australia was particularly expensive compared to as usual low cost USA, so wasn't spending on this as was not that in love with it. Had the pack had a clone, I would have been all over it, but it took a sale price of $34 AUD to make me give in.

And it really surprised me how much I enjoyed building this, and I grew to like the vehicle even more. Stickers didn't bother me much, but would have preferred as always printed bricks.

 

pros

  • ship is rather cool
  • enjoyable build
  • decent amount of brick for buck
  • reversible Anakin head

Cons

  • canopy doesn't fit flush with the ship
  • no hinge to get in to container/binoculars and light sabre
  • no clones

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: Nice and sturdy...
review:
The Freeco Speeder set (8085) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2010. It comes with 2 minifigures and 15 pieces. This set does include decals.

Minifigure:

  • Anakin Skywalker: Anakin comes with his parka and the basic LEGO Town - Arctic hood. He looks a little bit different than the Han Solo from the LEGO Star Wars Echo Base set (7749). He also comes with a blue lightsaber and he has a double-sided face. On one side you can see the normal clone wars face and on the back you can see his bandanna.
  • Thi-Sen: Thi-Sen comes with a spear and a grey torso and grey legs. His skin is attached to his head which looks like a squirrel. He also comes with a mohawk.

Freeco Speeder:

  • The Freeco Speeder is very nicely done. It comes with a trunk which snaps off and you can see a container where you can put the pair of binoculars. You can also put the lightsaber in the trunk. On the back are some great engines with some hammer pieces. The speeder slides on some skies and the cockpit lifts up easily.

 

Positive:

  • Rare Minifigures
  • Sturdy
  • Play features
  • Pieces for brickfilms and stopmotions

Negative:

  • It's a little bit overpriced
  • Stickers
  • It's a little bit annoying to give Anakin the joystick
  • The trunk should lift up the same way as the cockpit


All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on LEGO Shop@Home, Toys-R-US, eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.

Videos I made of this set:

Review: http://www.youtube.com/user/KLOKRIECHER?feature=mhum#p/u/6/_7qC037qEQo

author: meyerc13
title: Liked it more than I expected
review:
My son received this as a gift, and we put it together today.  Looking over all of the current Star Wars LEGO sets, this one never caught my attention.  I think it was a combination of the price, the environment specific attire being worn by Anakin, and the not overly memorable second character included as a minifig.

However, as I was putting this together this set began to appeal to me more and more.  As the Speeder was coming together, it started to remind me of an X-Wing or a Battlestar Galatica Viper.  It was a lot of fun to build, and I think you could use these parts as well as some of the design as a great start to create a fighter craft of your own.

Although it would be out of continuity, this speeder could also be used along with the various Hoth sets (the Imperial and Rebel Battlepacks, Wampa Cave, and Echo Base).  You might not want to use Anakin if you did that, but if you ditch the light saber and used a different head the rest of the figure could be useful as another arctic character.

Overall, I think this is a fun to build set that I would recommend picking up, especially if you can find it on sale.  Unlike some Star Wars sets this is a really solid build, and the parts are great.  Don't make the mistake I did and write this off without thinking of the other possibilities for the parts inside the box.

author: MAK_REBAN
title: Pretty Cool
review:

author: reidak12
title: Can't do Anything!
review:
I got this set for Christmas. It is a good representation of the Freeco Speeder, but it cannot do a single thing! All it can do is open. On the other hand, it has two rare minifigures.

Pros:

unique Anakin minifigure

rare Thi Shen minifigure

good size on the speeder

cargo hold

binoculars

stickers

Cons:

can't do anything

lightsaber falls out

In conclusion, this set is not a bad buy. They should however bring it down to twenty bucks.

author: SKip_E_Productions2
title: Off the Brick: Freeco Speeder
review:
Only my 3rd LEGO Star Wars set, 8085 Freeco Speeder is very disappointing.

 

Pros:

  • Nice minifigures. I really like Anakin the most. Thi-Sen has a mohawk. :)
  • Sleek design of the speeder. Lots of, what FBTB calls, "swooshability."

 

Cons:

  • Nowhere to store Anakin's lightsaber. I ended up having him sit on it.
  • The window above Anakin doesn't close all the way. Dang, it must be freezing in there.
  • Only one bad guy. Couldn't they at least throw in a clone and battle droid?
  • STICKERS.
  • Really boring and complicated set. As soon as you think you're done, it adds ANOTHER complicated step.

 

If you're a Star Wars fan, get this set. If not, skip it. You should be spending your money on Hero Factory or Ninjago or any good theme out there.

 

SKip-E-Productions2, signing off!

author: LEGOSLUG
title: Fantastic Set
review:
Here is my review of the LEGO set 8085 Freeco Speeder. Read on............

The Minifigures:

Anakin Skywalker : Double sided head, blue torso and grey legs.

Thi Sen : New head/torso piece, Grey torso and legs.

 

These Minifigures are unique to the set.

The Build:

The Build takes about half an hour, an it is a very interesting build too. The use of the parts is awesome, there is also a new element in the set as well. The finished model looks great, the new elements give it a sleek look.

Pros

* Cool new Minifigures.

* New pieces.

* Finished model looks good, and is strong.

Cons

* Stickers

* Should be 1 more minifigure-like a Clone, or another alien.

 

All in all it is a great set, the Pros outweigh the Cons, so add it to your Star Wars collection. 5/5

 

LEGOSLUG

 

P.S. Please see and rate my other reviews and bricklists.

author: StratTone
title: Not my favorite.
review: Looking at the box it looks like a nice little set but compared to same price sets this was a let down.  My biggest beef was with the way a snow vehicle has a cock-pit that doesn't even close properly and has huge gaps.  Not a waste of money but there are better sets.

author: murrayhenson
title: First built set in 20+ years
review:
I suspect that most readers will find it odd that the Freeco Speeder is how I have re-ignited my interest in Lego.  This was an impulse buy for me (Empik in the Rynek in Krakow, Poland) and not a cheap one at that - I paid 120 PLN for this aka ~38 USD.  However, the Freeco Speeder was one of the cheaper sets on offer and one of the more interesting-looking sets so there we go.

I haven't played with or otherwise assembled any Lego sets in 20+ years.  I found the Ikea-esq instructions fairly straight-forward although the brick coloring in the manual was sometimes difficult to interpret (dark grey vs. black, that sort of thing).  That being said, I spent a reasonable amount of time - not too little, not too long - assembling it.  Looked nice when it was done although putting the rather small stickers on was a fiddly business.


Pros

  • Looks pretty good when built, esp. if the stickers are properly aligned and placed.
  • Not necessarily cheap but not so expensive that your wife will say "no way".
  • Does supposedly have a unique Anakin figure.  This may be extra appealing if you like minifigs in parkas.

Cons

  • Price per brick is fairly high.
  • No where to store Anakin's lightsabre.  Maybe Thi-Sen can hold it for him?
  • Gaps between the windscreen and everything else.  Chilly.


Most importantly, I suppose, is the fact that this admittedly fairly small and somewhat overpriced set has me now with a lego.com account, reading reviews on brickset, checking out deals on sets on ebay, amazon and allego (Poland's big auction site) and generally thinking a lot about how to spend significant portions of future paychecks.  It's difficult to pin-point what about this set did it for me but there was just something about it.  I do not suspect the same experience will be had by others but I'm glad it was mine.

author: MrTaco
title: Definate buy for 6-11 year olds:
review:
BAM BAM! Anikin uses light-saber, 'EXPLOSION'! This is the sound a 6 or 7 year old would make while playing with this set. He would pounce around the house with the ship in his hands while making laser guns firing noises while doing so. I am 12 years old and received this set at 10 years of age and still display it now.

Pros

  • Pro 1: I spent my time having good fun when building. Making comments like "Oh this is a cool piece." It was a great building experience and the minifigs are great. The Thi-Sen has a head connecting to it's back and front. Anikin has two switchable heads, of him normal and with a mask on.
  • Pro 2: The overall picture was good but not much what I expected. It is treated more as a model than a toy.
  • …

Cons

  • Con 1: The price of £21 or $21 is appalling. I would think it would be worth £10, not the double. 
  • Con 2: Some pieces don't give the 'WOW' factor I expected due to old pieces used time and time again.
  • …

It's Pretty good but needs price lowering. It is more of a model than a play toy, because loose pieces here and there. But the product is very good. 


WELL DONE LEGO!

author: wii1232
title: Lots of Stickers!
review: This set I got as a gift, not for my birthday or Xmas, but just because.  The two new minifigs are cool and all, but the part that was interesting was that it didn't come with any printed bricks.  Instead, the details were all stickers.  I didn't get that part.  I didn't know what LEGO's point was in doing that.
